description: From Middle English seriously, sereously, ceryously, seryowslech (“earnestly”), equivalent to serious +‎ -ly.

adverbs.description: seriously (comparative more seriously, superlative most seriously)

entries.meaning: (manner) In a serious or literal manner.
examples: He was hoping that we would take him seriously.
Jimmy jokingly called Bob a doofus. Bob took the insult seriously.
That was a seriously unpleasant thing to say.

entries.meaning: Used to attempt to introduce a serious point in a less serious conversation.
examples: Now, seriously, why did you forget to feed the cat today?

entries.meaning: Used to call back to a previous point, in disbelief or for emphasis.
examples: You baked 10 cakes. Seriously, why did you do that?

entries.meaning: (informal) In an extreme or major way; majorly
examples: Unless you're seriously strapped (armed), you're about to be not okay too.
